page.title: 05Pitlessie School
page.content: Pitlessie Primary occupies a central position in the village. It is an old building with schoolhouse adjoining. There has been a school on the site since 1700 although the original building was a very much smaller one than the one standing today. 44 pupils attend the school and these are divided into two classes. The younger class of P1-P4 is taught by Mrs.Welsh.The headteacher Mrs.Pratt teaches the older class P5-P7 The school has a close-knit family atmosphere and has strong links with the village community.Several events are organised each session involving parents local people and pupils and the recent formation of a parent- teacher association has proved very successful.
